meanings.definition: Able to be wooed or courted.
meanings.sent1: She is so wooable that many suitors try to win her heart.
meanings.sent2: The charming prince found the princess to be very wooable.
meanings.sent3: The shy boy found a wooable way to ask his crush to the school dance.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a wooable melody that enchanted everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flowers in the garden were so wooable that they attracted many bees.

meanings.definition: Desirable or attractive to be pursued romantically.
meanings.sent1: The movie star was considered very wooable by her fans.
meanings.sent2: He found her smile to be incredibly wooable and couldn't resist asking her out.
meanings.sent3: The delicious aroma of the bakery was so wooable that it drew in customers from afar.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in a wooable palette of colors that took their breath away.
meanings.sent5: The cozy cafe had a wooable ambiance that made it a popular spot for couples.
